snippet: The government’s ability to revoke citizenship, and the fact it has used that ability against people who were later killed in drone strikes, has fueled concern.
abstract: Government of British Prime Min David Cameron, faced with concerns that steady stream of British Muslims traveling to fight in Syria could pose a threat on their return, is pushing legislation to expand its right to revoke citizenship, which among other things keeps terrorism suspects from re-entering the country; is seeking to include naturalized citizens who have no other nationality and would be rendered stateless.

byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The government’s ability to revoke citizenship, and the fact it has used that ability against people who were later killed in drone strikes, has fueled concern.

headline.main: Britain Increasingly Invokes Power to Disown Its Citizens
headline.print_headline: Britain Increasingly Invokes Power to Disown Its Citizens
